status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. Comcast was installing new conduit and manholes on Congress St. In order to have a smooth and level final paving product, the contractor installs a base course of hot mix asphalt first. Once the base course has been set up, the contractor comes back and applies the final top course. This was done over the weekend. What the constituent observed the trench left in the base course condition. Since the work was permitted for weekends, the base course sat for a week. The City apologizes for the inconvenience for this necessary work. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

The CIU investigated and determined that the National Grid contractor responsible for restoring the sidewalks to concrete after temporarily leaving in asphalt, did the sidewalks work on Columbus Ave. The City provides the utility companies with neighborhood permits to restore sidewalks. status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. The BRA maintains those planters along with the Back Bay. Association. The BRA is working with Public Works to demolish the planters. by the end of the month. The Back Bay Association is in the process of working with MassDOT to get. permission to replace the planters with smaller versions that hopefully. will hold up better and not be as close to the edge of the medians (so less. prone to damage).  MassDOT owns the bridge upon which the planters sit, so. MassDOT has to review the proposed new planters to ensure that the bridge. can handle the additional load.  The goal is to have MassDOT sign off on. the planters and install them this summer.  We don't have a more exact time. frame at this point. Thank you. -Kristin.

description:
City of Boston

Trash bins are constantly left on the curb out of trash days. This has been going on for more than 2 years. The response I received from the city after my last complains: "officer O'Keefe found no violation". I'm very confused. From my understanding leaving trash bins on the curb out of trash days is a violation. It is not allowed in the Fenway (I used to live there), in Back Bay, and other areas of Boston, so why it is allowed in my neighborhood? Either my husband or I walk on that area every day, and there is ALWAYS at least one trash/recycle bin filled with household trash in the curb. This picture was taken today, Monday, 06/09/14, around 8:40 AM. Very much ahead of the allowed time for trash and recycle days on Tuesdays and Fridays. I will continue to send them on a regular basis so you can become aware that this situation can no longer be deemed as a "non violation".Thank you. Cristina Silva

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving. It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes. The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride. The street is leafleted before the work begins where it explains that it is a mufti phase construction operation and you should look at the dates since they will change as each construction phases progresses. Our goal is to allow parking between phases and not post the street for the entire time the work takes place. This is why the contractor repeatedly changes the dates. We spoke to the contractor about his need to be totally accurate when posting for upcoming work. Since this is a patching contract, the contractor may only be on your street for only a short period of time; giving the appearance of not showing up. Sometimes  poor weather, plant breakdowns, or equipment failure occurs which results in the delay of the upcoming work. The CIU spoke to the contractor about his need to do a better job on changing the dates when those situations arise. Any questions you call the City Engineer Tom Mougamian. . The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. National Grid installed a new main on your street. The city highly encourages this type of work. It will eliminate possible future emergency leak repairs. The city acknowledges that the construction will cause an inconvenience to the residents. However in the long run the construction is well worth it. We also acknowledge that the trench has failed in sections, and needs to be repaired. The CIU emailed National Grid and instructed them to repair the trench within 2 weeks. The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
